name: Hilton Times Square

reviews.text: In a recent long weekend in NYC with the family, it became the break most parents dread! Firstly the wife came down with stomach flu the night we arrived, followed by our 6 year old the next night. The staff at the hotel at 3am were brilliant! they took care of everything. The next day we decided to cut our break short & get home ASAP with our two children. Once again the staff at the hotel really took care of us and were extremely supportive given our situation. I stay in many hotels around the world on a regular basis and the front desk and night staff were the best I have encountered in a long time. If service is important to you - I really recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Thanks for all your help!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be in the heart of New York, and we were not disappointed! The room was great (newly refurbished) and surprisingly peaceful for a spot in the centre of the "city that never sleeps" No problem sleeping for us! The big surprise was the friendliness and helpful attitude of the staff, something one can never be sure of, especially in a hotel as busy and cosmopolitan as this one. Ami and Bradley, on the front desk, could not have been more helpful when we needed important documents printed, copied and finally emailed back to our lawyers in the UK. It was all achieved quickly and without fuss. The next morning, Gazi our breakfast waiter saved my day, by finding and restoring to me, my hearing aid box which had fallen out of my bag and lay hidden under the table.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, topped by friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.text: Getting around the city on foot was easy, and to enjoy a night out at the theatre on Broadway, without having to scramble for a cab at the end of the show, was sheer luxury.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, ok service

reviews.text: On all counts, we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect for a Business and Pleasure

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel last summer. Hotel feels luxurious, staff acts high class, the guest seem affluent, but the service is just ok, Staff will not go over and beyond for a guest. At the time I had Gold status with Hilton, but I was not upgraded. Additionally they did not grant me access to the lounge. The rooms look nice, typical Hilton room, nothing less and nothing more. I stayed at few other hotels in NYC, this one ranks mid level, mainly because service was not at the same level as other hotels in Times Square. Location is very good, it is in Times Square but hidden to the side so guest are not bothered by the constant noise of Times Square. If you have Diamond status with Hilton, I would highly recommend this hotel. If not, prices are a bit high and service is ok, so maybe I would say you can do better for the same price. I give it 4 stars because it is a cool looking hotel.
reviews.title: This hotel is brilliant

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights arriving on the 26th December. Rooms are large by NYC standards and hotel was very comfortable. Problems with check-in - like previous reviewer we booked an non-smoking room with two beds (in fact we paid a little more to be guaranteed this!) However, as has happened before with Hilton, this room was not available again. We protested and eventually were offered a smoking room with two beds. We asked to see it before we agreed and found it to be reasonably odour free. At check-in George was pleasant and helpful and offered us complimentary breakfast for our inconvenience. This was nice but not worth the money if we had to pay extra for it.
reviews.title: Rooms large - crowded streets
great location and hotel
reviews.text: The other big fault of the hotel was it's location. It's about two blocks from time square but right next to Madame Tusauds and the subway. Each time you exited the hotel you were shoulder to shoulder with people and queues. To travel a block could take 20 minute!!

reviews.title: Just Okay for New Years
reviews.text: My advise would be to stay a litte away from Time Square for a little more comfort and peace and quite.

reviews.title: Best vacation ever-Yes New York, New York
reviews.text: Great Location, Nice decor for the hotel's front desk
very efficient service
reviews.title: Fabulous experience at the Hilton

reviews.text: Our family of four (Mom, Dad, 7 yr. old and 3 yr. old) travelled into the city for a one night stay to "show" NYC to the kids. We drove into the city from NJ, and the ease of getting to this hotel from the Lincoln Tunnel cannot be overstated. (I cannot speak to the hotel's parking, as I found an online coupon for a parking lot two blocks down the road for 24 hours. So we parked there instead. I highly recommend anyone travelling to the city does the same! We basically parked for a dollar an hour!)
reviews.title: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

reviews.text: The hotel entrance is not magnificent or grand in any way, because the bulk of it sits above restaurants and Madame Tussaud's wax museum on W. 42nd St. It is possible to miss the Hilton sign among the others! We arrived about an hour and a half before check in, but were given our room key with a smile and a welcome without a second's hesitation. The front desk staff were absolutely fantastic. We arrived at our room on the 32nd floor and noticed the view immediately. We could see the Empire state building to the left, and the freedom tower directly in front of our window (more distant than the Empire, but still beautiful). The hotel also sits across the street from the New York Times building. THE perfect setting for tourists!
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location.

reviews.text: The room itself was spotless. Crisp, white bedding, granite counter-tops on all surfaces. Bathroom stocked with plenty of towels, and even had a sliding door as a space-saver! Most people don't spend a lot of time in their rooms, but with two children we were calling it a night pretty early. All of us fell asleep quickly and comfortably, with no city noise to keep us awake at all! We did hear our neighbors' television for a short time, but that can be expected in any hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every staff member we passed had a warm hello. Cannot say enough about their demeanor. At one point our elevator did not stop at our floor, ignoring the down call button. I mentioned this to the front desk staff where they apologized profusely. When we returned for a quick break, the elevator servicemen were already tending to the problem. It was fixed within a few hours!
reviews.title: Awesome location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect. Again, with little legs in tow, it was great to check out Times Square without having to cross many streets or contend with long walks. Toys R Us, is so close!! We had a lovely trip, and it was in large part to the clean, welcoming, beautifully situated Hilton Times Square. I would absolutely stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Fab location, spacious room

reviews.text: The best part about this hotel is the view. You know it from the moment you take the elevator to the lobby. The only problem I've ever had is a wait at the check in desk, and a lack of SUV cabs (we had 5 in our party). The location is prime for anyone visiting the city but the hotel is professional and perfect for a business stay. Close enough to walk to Carmine's or ToysRUS, and yet high enough to miss the car horns and bustle of the city. From one side, we saw the Christmassy Empire State Building. Another side gave us a birds eye view of the street. You can walk to Dwayne Reed's for any travel necessities and you're across the street from about 5 different fast food, quick service, or sit down restaurants. Perfect for winter nights when you stay inside as long as possible. The staff is friendly and the rooms are spacious. What can I say...I wouldn't stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Right in the Middle of it All

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the hilton times square
reviews.title: loved it
Great Hotel!!!!
reviews.text: and we had the best 9 days of our life.
the staff were v helpful alex,ernest and george
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: try to avoid the female staff,the hotel is located 2min from times square,lowes and amc theaters right nextdoor our deluxe king room was v nice and large
reviews.title: Fab Hotel
Reasonbly Priced, Great Location for First Timers
reviews.text: This hotel was a great find last minute. With a trip to NYC booked less than 3 weeks out in the fall, there weren't many recommendable options for less than $250-300 @ night. If you've been to NYC before and are interested in more than just the Square, I'd recommend staying somewhere else, but if this is your first time, you can't go wrong with this place!

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: The only negatives I have are not real negatives, rather nit-picky annoyances. First, have to take an elevator up 20 floors from the entrance, to reach the lobby, then you take another set of elevators to your room. (the elevators are fast and there's not much of a wait, but if you get out to the street and realize you forgot something, you gotta go back up an elevator, through the lobby, up another elevator, then vice versa.

Next, anytime you come into the hotel there's a guard asking to see your room key. I'm sure this is to make sure only guests use the hotel facilities, though it didn't appear there were many non-guests attempting to get on the elevator.
reviews.title: Minor hitch but overall very good
Superb Hotel
reviews.text: I used the iron and ironing board the first night and housekeeping never put it away, which I thought was kinda strange. Also, housekeeping comes a bit early... 9-ish or so. It's fine if you're up and at 'em, but if you're out till 4 or 5 each night like we were, it's kinda early, so remember to put out the DND sign.

reviews.title: Great Location and Price
reviews.text: Like I said, these aren't really negatives, but may be helpful to know for some folks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in February after staying for two nights at the Millenium Hilton in the financial district.
reviews.title: Fantiastic!

reviews.text: Firstly the location was superb as it is right in the heart of Times Square. Over the two days we walked from our hotel to the many different sights including the Rockefellar Centre, Grand Central, and library with ease. Nightime was fantastic with the choice of different restaurants, shows, cinema or for just a walk round times square to soak up the atmosphere!
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel - excellent service
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Hotel and our room was also excellent , very clean and very large for New York standards. We had a great view overlooking the Empire State Building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good and we mentioned on our booking form we had a birthday so they sent up a large plate of chocolate strawberries which went down a treat!
reviews.title: Great Choice for a Times Square hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hotel and could find no faults with it whatsoever.
reviews.title: warning - credit card required

likes.disliked: — demand for credit card at check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an excellent time! Right in the middle of Times Square so everything was in walking distance. So cheap, clean and the staff was so nice. The rooms were a decent size too!! I would definetly stay here again!
reviews.title: This hotel was wonderful!!
Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: this is a very good hotel on 42nd street right by TImes Square. The staff is very helpful. Rooms are well appointed, clean and quiet. We have stayed at several hotels in the area, and this one is one of the best. It is a very busy hotel with many guests that ask a lot of questions, so the staff can get worn out at certain times of the day. Enjoy staying at a hotel with international travelers. They are enjoying all that NYC has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the heart of downtown New York and within walking distance to everything! The only thing is you will be paying for everything. The cost of the room is for location only. The amenities are so so. They do not provide any complimentary breakfast but they do have beautiful rooms.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay started fantastically with Peter A checking us in (early!). He was super helpful, VERY VERY nice, and a great guy to have at the front desk as the first person you meet! Peter was very enthusiastic and it was definitely contagious. He very excitedly told me that I had a room on the 42nd floor of a 44 floor building and that the view would be really neat. I got excited off his excitement and gave him a high five!
reviews.title: Would Come Back-Very friendly staff

reviews.text: The room was pretty spacious for a NYC hotel, and in a great location. Our room was on the 42nd floor, and it was a great view :) Everything was very nice. The only complaint I had was that the cleaning staff started coming around and knocked on our door at 8:30am! make sure you put your "privacy" up if you don't want to be woken on. I believe there might be some construction going on, as well, because I heard some hammering around 10am. I yelled for them to stop it and it stopped. I told the front desk, and they were very apologetic and offered us breakfast. Overall, I think the stay was made much better because of the helpful and super friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a fabulous wknd in NYC. The Hilton Times Square is very nice........not spectacular. The staff was very helpful. The rooms clean and comfortable. The view from the 27th was nothing to brag about and when I asked for a higher floor I was told nothing was available. I was disappointed with the entry. I liked the location but I did not like the "hall" atmosphere as you entered from the street. There were always people in front of the doors.....not allowing easy access. Once inside the staff was usually visible and secure. The lobby is small and not really inviting. The room was very nice.....big and equipped with all the comforts necessary for a pleasant stay. I'm just not sure if I will return......
reviews.title: Fine time but some room for improvement
Wonderful New York
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, nice view, close to Times Square... almost everything was perfect. mJust a bit of embarrasement once you entered the hall, as you had to take the elevator to the lobby

reviews.title: Hotel Great - Room Service Terrible
reviews.text: always had to show everything to the guards..
Nice view from 36th floor room overlooking skyscrapers at Times Square
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel...no complaints at all!
'Good' though not 'Great'
reviews.text: Just returned from a Thanksgiving stay at the Hilton. The Room was wonderful. We used Hilton Points for part of the stay and it could not have been better. Great service, great view -- terrific location - just a good experience.

reviews.title: Fab!
reviews.text: Fab hotel. Everything about it was great. From the minute we arrived the staff were great and instantly made us feel welcome. The rooms are clean and modern and the view from our room on the 42nd floor, where we could see the Empire State Building was brilliant.

reviews.title: Heart of Times Square......Brillient
reviews.text: Originally we were going to stay at a hotel overlooking Central Park but Im glad we chose this hotel instead as the location cannot be beaten. We felt we were central to everything and there is such a buzz day and night in Times Square. It is also extremely near to Port Authority where we got the bus to Woodbury Common (a must for shopaholics)
We will definitely be coming back to New York and without a doubt we will be staying here again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel
New, clean, curteous, luxurious.
reviews.text: Loved the Hilton. All the staff were really nice and helpful. The hotel rooms are really big and the beds.......Heaven, after all the walking around the Big Apple!!!!

reviews.title: Terrific Hotel / Fabulous Location!
reviews.text: Will deff stay there again when we visit New York! Plus you feel really really safe as there are handsome mounted police right outside the entrance!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Hilton Time Square with my girlfriend on a 4 day city break. We flew in from London. As a diamond VIP Hilton cardholder I have experienced a number of Hiltons, mostly in the UK. I think my expectations may have been slight high.
reviews.title: Great Location, resonable rooms

reviews.text: Location-wise we couldn't have asked for anything more. Bang in the middle of the tourist hotspot that is Time Square. It's easy from here to get to all the major landmarks.
reviews.title: top quality :)

reviews.text: There was a bit of a mix up when we arrive with finding a room for us, which took 1/2 an hour or so to sort out, but the staff were professional and friendly and offered us free drinks while we waited. In other Hilton hotels there is usually a executive floor for free drinks, nibbles, but unfortunately none here. Instead we were offered free breakfast which we took. The room was ok, a little old and shabby. They are in the process of updating the rooms. Views were fantastic. We got a room on the 38th floor and had great views over time square and the empire state building.
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service

reviews.text: Breakfasts were very good. Lots of different foods each day and polite service staff.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I suppose I was a little disappointed to the finishes and state of the hotel and the fact there wasn't an executive floor, but all in all a good stay. New York is great! Best city I've been too so far as a tourist!
reviews.title: A great place to stay

likes.disliked: — not knowing about 41st street entrance in advance

reviews.text: If you want to be smack in the middle of Times Square hustle & bustle, this is the place. (on 42nd street)
reviews.title: If you like hustle bustle - this is the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As someone in another review mentioned, it can be hard to locate, look for the large clock near the Applebee's. You enter at ground level and the lobby is on the 24th floor. The staff was courteous and helpful, the room was clean, well appointed, nice size and with very comfortable beds (I even had a view of the river). The bar area is nice as well as the breakfast.
reviews.title: My Favorite in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative - for me - is that it IS in the middle of the hustle and bustle. I was there for a trade show rather than to take in the sights so much and 42nd street where the hotel is located could be thronging with people from mid-day through the late hours of the night - so much so that it was difficult to walk down the street. However, the well-connected subway station is conveniently located steps away and a plethora of lovely little restaurants can be found a few blocks away west of 8th on 46th street.
reviews.title: Will DEFINITELY stay in this hotel again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually stay at the Warwick (smaller, nice, still near Times Square but on 54th/6th where it is a little quieter) and might still prefer that, but other than the crowded street, I have to say I did like the Hilton Times Square.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, nothing shabby about the rooms or halls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and myself go to New York for the weekend a couple of times every year. We've stayed at the Hilton on Ave of Americas, the Wellington, and the Westin. We just stayed here and this may be a close tie with the Westin as our favorite. Great location and Fantastic staff, especially Jimmy at the front counter. Close to everything. A bit expensive but what isn't in NYC. I will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent customer service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Times Sq the week following Memorial Day on hhonors points. Our room was great and the staff was very attentive. The breakfast buffet was also good. The hotel is a hop skip and a jump a way from Times Sq and many subway stations. The only drawback to the hotel in my mind was their bar - it was off the lobby and had no scene. But then again, you are in NYC and there are plenty of other places to go.
reviews.title: Great Location. Good Hilton Hotel

reviews.text: I just returned from a lovely "one night" stay at the Times Square Hilton. The location is terrific, less than one block from Times Square. The nearest subway stop is in the same block. I received a lovely room in the corner, so windows on both sides. The room was very large and had a king bed, a chair and ottoman, a desk with two chairs - every thing you needed. The bathroom was very nice and the towels were really very soft and thick - not like some hotel towels. All the staff members were friendly and helpful. The only couple of drawbacks or difficulties, as others have mentioned, it is a bit difficult to find. I really appreciated the tip to "look for the large clock" - because it just does look like a storefront, not a hotel. Also, you need to know that the parking is not on 42nd street, it is on 41st street. You need to go around the block. They will valet it there, but factually, I saw a parking garage directly across the street and I concluded that it would probably be substantially less expensive to "valet it myself" - no parking is inexpensive in NYC - but I didn't pay Hilton's premium.... The only drawback in the hotel itself was that it appeared, although I didn't ask, that the only breakfast option was a buffet. I went to sit down, saw the buffet, and no indication of menus, so I left. This probably saved me a fortune too - so no great loss. All in all, it was a lovely stay and I would recommend it to anyone who wanted a nice, central hotel in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Top of Times Square

likes.disliked: — Breakfast buffet seemed to be only option

reviews.text: me & my friend went to new york in march for 3 nights which for starters wasnt long enough you need at least a week as there is so much to see in very little time .we stayed at the hilton times square hotel which is as the name says in times square well its just about 100 yards round the corner .we were really impressed on arrival we got out of our cab & the staff were there waiting to take your bags up to the room .staff on reception were really helpful & quick at checking us in. the hotel is really modern & the rooms were lovely we had a double bed each which was really comfatable as we suffered terrible jet lag but it didnt spoil it for us anyway going back to the rooms there was a big tv with games console & mini bar , desk , telephone , dressing gowns toiletries , tea &coffee facilities internet access & the best bit we pulled back the curtains to see our view & wow what a view it was there in front of us the empire state building which was fantastic we were on the 32nd floor it seems a long way up & it is but the hotel is built on top of a cinema & waxworks museum you could see for miles up there it was brill.on each corridor in the hotel was buckets of ice for you to take to your room which was handy .the hotel was really clean & nothing was too much trouble for the staff they couldnt do enough for you .the location of the hotel was fantanstic
reviews.title: brilliant hotel,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for tourist like our selfs it was only a few steps to times square about a 5 minute walk to central park it was about the same to 5th avenue & macys shopping department store we got a cab down to the world trade centre site which didnt cost much at all as you couldnt walk down there as it was bit too far & straight across from there is a department store called centuary 21 which i highly recommend as its got some really good bargins there is everything in there to suit all ages . the hotel did room service 24hrs a day too which was handy when you wanted a slice of carrott cake at midnight like we did (lol) but if you you were wanting a meal we went next door to the hotel to a place callled applebys its a restaurant chain in newyok & its delicious they sell steaks, salads ,chicken & its prices were good too they also do a mean apple pie & icecream for dessert. i had no faults at all with this hotel & will definately return again to this hotel i just wouldnt go to newyork again in march as it was freezing i will make sure my next trip takes place in the summer
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location
Great week in Times Square
reviews.text: We stayed at the Times Square Hilton for one night (27 May - the night before Memorial Day). We were booked into the Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square for 6 nights but when we arrived on the Sunday evening they had no room for us, so they arranged to get a taxi for us to take us to the Hilton for one night.

We stayed at the Hilton, Times Square for 4 nights. It is a lovely, friendly, safe haven situated right in the middle of the action. This was our first trip to New York, and it was a fantastic place to stay. Check in was pleasurable after a long flight, Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Stay...

reviews.text: Our room was on the 31st floor, and despite ongoing construction at a nearby site, this cause no disruption or noise, and didn't affect our great view either.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Security was excellent. The room was really very clean, and the standard of house-keeping was second to none. We tended to eat out, and spent little time in the hotel, even so, it was worth every penny paid.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel!!

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed New York City, with the help of a sound hotel, and would recommend it to first timers like we were!!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: There was only one annoyance during our stay. On our last day we checked out at 12pm and the Hilton stored our luggage until 6pm when we returned. This was a great service as our flight didn't leave until 8pm. We returned to the hotel at 6pm, got our luggage and wanted a taxi in order to get to our flight. The porter said he'd sort one out, but instead of hailing a cab, he phoned a "contact" who kept us waiting for at least 20mins! It was pretty clear when the cab finally turned up (after watching many drive by) that the porter and driver had some sort of beneficial deal, which did not benefit us in the slightest!
reviews.title: Excellent. Loved It!!!
Fabulous Stay with Great Views
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights 25 - 30 December - this hotel could not be faulted. Ask for a room on a high floor - we were on 42nd floor with views over 42nd Street. Rooms extremely spacious and decorated to a high standard and fluffy bathrobes and toiletries provided along with coffee making facilities. No problems with lifts - speedy and efficient. Staff could not be faulted - concierge and reception staff pleasant and helpful as were the doormen. Not keen on restaurant and bar area being open plan but good for people watching - will definitely return here!

We stayed there from Dec.17-20. It had a bit of a rough start, but in the end a very nice place to stay. We had booked a two double bed room on the 43rd floor and ended up with a King size bed on the 29th and had to fight with some young man at the front desk over the phone to get our room changed. He said nothing was available and it was our fault so we were fuming... but as soon as we left the room there was a hall monitor who immediately asked what was wrong and called the front desk and got our room changed in a second by the time we got down to the front desk they had our new keys waiting for an even better room... Rachel and whoever that hall monitor woman was were perfect, but the young man on the phone was horrible and needs a lesson in dealing with customers who just spent over a thousand dollars on their hotel. The other bad things were that when you were in your room you could hear a chorus of toilets flushing from all over the floor you were on. Our sliding key cards also stopped working for our door one night which we needed to exchange for a new pair.
reviews.title: Great hotel... for the most part.
Great location and service
reviews.text: The good things were the security and staff were all so friendly(except one!), the front lobby is beautiful and the room was a great size for a NY room. The place is very clean which was one of the reasons why we chose this hotel. The view was amazing as well... couldn't have asked for more, we had a view looking south at the Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens and the Hudson River. The location was great, just a half block from Times Square which was nice to kind of escape from right beside a subway entrance as well. We might try somewhere else when we return, but always a great option.

reviews.title: Just returned from my stay (Dec. 18 to 21)
reviews.text: Stayed here with kids December 19-20. Rooms are big by New York standards. We had a southern view with a great look at the Empire State Building. Lobby is small, but comfortable. This is the biggest difference between here and the big name hotels, which offer much more presence. Had a great breakfast buffet at the restaurant with smoked salmon and bagels. The concierge gave us a pass to Mars 2112, which is fantastic if you're under 12, but worthless for adults. We have stayed in quite a few NYC hotels and absolutely loved this one!!

reviews.title: Treated us like royalty
reviews.text: I just got back from a stay at the Hilton Times Square. I loved New York and the hotel was in a fab location. Just a few steps to McDonald's, Champs, Applebee's (awful), and Subway. I liked Hilton Times Square but I have had my resevations for over three months and when I got there to check in, at 12 p.m., even though I had requested an early check in I did not get into my room until 5 o'clock which was two hours past there check in time. That left my family and I to roam around New York til then. They did store our luggage until then for us though which made it very helpful. Hotel staff was incrediably helpful and rooms were very nice. Hilton was not in what we think of as "Times Square" but was just around the corner (literally). Overall I would probably stay there again.

For the past several years I've been staying at Hilton Times Square during NY City visits. My most recent stay was in August 2005. I generally visit Manhattan about twice a year and see 3 to 4 shows during one weekend. I've been returning to this hotel because I can usually count on a decent room in a convenient location at a good price (at least by NY standards). A few weeks ago I purchased Broadway tickets for a weekend in March 2006. I intended to book a room at Hilton as usual, but found that the standard room I last paid about $187.00 for was up to $329. I've paid just over $200 there before, but never over $300. My chosen weekend is not on or near a holiday. I've been watching prices for several hotels and see that Hilton's fluctuate quite a bit. Over the past few weeks their standard room price rose to $329 and dropped to $246. I saw it go back up a few dollars to $249, but a nonrefundable price of $212 was then offered (not available before). I later did back-to-back searches and saw that the $212 offer did not come up every time. Now it doesn't come up at all. This leaves me wondering how many times I've overpaid in the past. I also think of the people who have booked at $329 without following up and seeing the price drop. My concerns have been brought to the attention of Hilton Times Square and Hilton Corporate. I've made a reservation elsewhere for March. I will also take some time from that trip to research other hotels for future visits. I have nothing bad to say about the accommodations at Hilton Times Square. I may even return someday, but not before I can be sure that I am not a victim of price gouging.
reviews.title: Beware of Pricing

reviews.text: I arrived at the Hilton Times Square at 8 AM expecting to check my backs with the concierge. I was pleasantly surprised when I was allowed to check-in! My room was very comfortable and exceptionally clean. The hotel's location is very convenient to the Olympia Trails bus from Newark Airport (1 block away from stop). Inexpensive restaurants surround this hotel, and I felt comfortable walking back alone from nearby theatres late at night. Great location to access two subway stations and the 42nd street bus.
reviews.title: Very Accomodating!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a Sat. night in January through PriceLine for a bid of $110. Some hotels relegate Priceline bookings to the least desirable rooms, but this hotel did not. We were in a great room on the 34th floor (above and to the right of the Mme Toussaud golden hand) with King bed (as requested). We had a delightful stay. The location is very good. Keep an eye out for the clock marking the entrance, as it is easy to miss. In the evening, a room key must be shown to the guard to gain access to the lobby elevator. We visit NYC frequently; this was the biggest standard room we've ever booked. There was an easy chair w/ottoman and side table, a large work desk with two chairs and a big closet. There wasn't much drawer space. Pillows and linens were of high quality. The bathroom was small with a shower/tub combo. and the coffee machine on the sink. We would have liked brighter lighting over the sink. Towels were fluffy, Crabtree and Evelyn personal care products. Of note, there is some sort of huge air handling unit below our room location, but we were high enough for it not to intrude. I would imagine that a few floors lower it could be a problem.
reviews.title: Great price, pleasant experience

reviews.text: I've stayed a few times at the Hilton Times Square and each time had a very nice room and experience. The location is great and very convenient. Most of the staff is very helpful.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: In a first class position this hotel exceeded our expectations. Ths staff were exemplary from security to front desk and the housekeeping & bar staff too.
reviews.title: A hotel that others may be judged by.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton with work for two nights - I wanted space, a view and a safe and central location. The Hilton delivers on all fronts.
reviews.title: Clean, spacious and practical hotel in the heart of Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are huge by NYC standards and pretty clean. They've kept things to a minimum - so toiletries are very basic, no slippers, no mini-bar but with Duane Reade and the bars in town this is no problem.
reviews.title: Great location- Great people- Very nice/update/clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great deal for a reasonable price in NYC - modern with no frills.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Our first trip to NYC and we used Hilton Points. Very clean room, thanks to housekeeper Ceretta McAllister. Room was very nice and larger than expected for this piece of real estate. My own personal preference is that I do not like the pillow top mattresses that they use, but that can be removed. Whatever your preference is.
reviews.title: Purely for tourists!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location made it so easy to get to any part of the city. Lots within walking distance.
reviews.title: good

aka: Hilton Times Square Hotel New York City
description: Hilton Times Square is a sleek, landmark New York City hotel that was built in 2000 and soars 44 stories above Manhattan. This upscale, full-service contemporary hotel is located on famous 42nd Street in the heart of Times Square, and is surrounded by Broadway theaters, lively nightlife, New York City’s best shopping and many restaurants and bars. Boasting a Modernistic façade and sweeping vistas of New York City’s famous skyline and the Hudson River, the hotel has been recently renovated and is the perfect hotel choice for business and leisure travelers seeking modern amenities while staying in the Big Apple’s best location.Hilton Times Square offers 460 of the largest standard size guestrooms in Midtown Manhattan, with spectacular panoramic views and high-end amenities. These spacious guestrooms have been recently renovated, start on the 23rd floor and are over 330 square feet. Deluxe guestrooms begin on the 33rd floor. All guestrooms are luxuriously appointed in soothing sand tones, 37-inch flat screen televisions, laptop size safe, MP3 players are more.Additional amenities and services found at Hilton Times Square hotel in New York include: -Restaurant Above, the hotel's Zagat-rated restaurant, is perched 21 stories above Times Square in the hotel lobby and offers notable American cuisine fused with fresh ingredients.-Pinnacle Bar is also located in the hotel lobby and overlooks Times Square.-Evening room service.-24-hour Fitness Center.-24-hour full service, automated Business Center.-Full-service Concierge desk, valet dry cleaning and valet parking available.
